item.title: 3.4 Examples
item.description:
3.4 Logarithmic Derivatives: Examples

Ex1.

Differentiate \( f(x) = \ln(5x) \)

Solution:
The derivative of \( \ln(u) \) with respect to \( x \) is \( \frac{1}{u} \cdot u' \), where \( u = 5x \).

  1. Differentiate \( u(x) = 5x \):
    \( u'(x) = 5 \)
  2. Apply the chain rule:
    \[ f'(x) = \frac{1}{5x} \cdot 5 \]
  3. Simplify:
    \[ f'(x) = \frac{5}{5x} = \frac{1}{x} \]
\[ f'(x) = \frac{1}{x} \]

3.4 Derivatives of Logarithmic Functions

Ex1.

Differentiate the following function:

\[ f(x) = \ln(4x) \]
Solution

Using the chain rule:

\[ \frac{d}{dx}[\ln(u)] = \frac{1}{u} \cdot u' \]

Let \( u = 4x \). Then \( u' = 4 \).

  1. Apply the chain rule: \[ f'(x) = \frac{1}{4x} \cdot 4 \]
  2. Simplify: \[ f'(x) = \frac{4}{4x} = \frac{1}{x} \]
